alert.note: Alert for Garfield (Utah) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued August 17 at 12:14PM MDT until August 17 at 4:00PM MDT by NWS Saltlake
info.description: The National Weather Service in Salt Lake City has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... Central Garfield County in southern Utah... * Until 400 PM MDT. * At 1214 PM MDT, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the warned area...specifically within the Birch Creek and North Creek areas. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly... with the expected flood waves moving into the upper Escalante River downstream into Escalante River Canyon. HAZARD...Life threatening flash flooding. Thunderstorms producing flash flooding. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Life threatening flash flooding of creeks and streams, and normally dry washes. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Escalante. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Remain alert for flooding even in locations not receiving rain. Dry washes, streams, and rivers can become raging killer currents in a matter of minutes, even from distant rainfall.
